tests.title: Tests for {{projectName}}
tests.subtitle: Configure the tests of this project
tests.dockerScriptPlaceholder: Enter docker script or upload file
tests.fileStructureTooltip:
This templates specifies the file structure a submission has to follow.
It uses the following syntax:
* Folders end on `'/'`
* Use indents to specify files inside a folder
* Regex can be used
	* `'.'` is still a normal `'.'`
	* `'\.'` can be used as regex `'.'`
* `'-'` at the start of a line specifies a file/folder that is not allowed
tests.dockerImageTooltip: Specify a valid Docker-container from [Docker Hub](https://hub.docker.com/) on which the test script will be run.
tests.dockerScriptTooltip:
Bash-script that is executed.
* The files of the student's submission can be found in `'/shared/input'`
* Extra files uploaded below can be found in `'/shared/extra'`

 More information about the required output depends on the mode and can be found below.
tests.dockerTemplateTooltip: To specify specific tests, you need to provide a template. First, enter the test name with '@{test}'. Below this, you can use '>' to provide options such as ('>required', '>optional', '>description'). Everything under these options until the next test or the end of the file is the expected output.
tests.dockerTestDirTooltip:
Upload additional files needed for the Docker test.

These files are available in the folder `'/shared/extra'`.
tests.simpleModeInfo:
Without template, the student will see everything that the scripts prints/logs as feedback.

If the test is successful, `'Push allowed'` must be written to `'/shared/output/testOutput'`. If this does not happen, the test is considered failed.
tests.templateModeInfo:
If you provide a template, the student will see a comparison between the expected output and the student's output for each test.

The template uses the following syntax:
* `@testName`: the first line of a test starts with `'@'` followed by the name of the test
* Optionally, a number of options can be provided:
	* `>[required|optional]`: indicates whether the test is mandatory or optional
	* `>description="..."`: description of the test
* The lines after the options are the expected output of the test. The last newline is not considered part of the output.

dockerTemplateValidation.inValidFirstLine: The first line of a test must be '@' followed by the name of the test

tests.dockerScriptRequired: Docker script is required if u specify a Docker image

submission.structureTestFailed: Submission does not meets the structure requirements
